WRITING.TITLE: The Evil Within (2017) The spiritual successor to "The Room"
WRITING.TEXT:
I finished watching this and have no idea what its about or gone on, this is as if The Room crossed Forrest Gump as a horror movie. Dialogue is hilarious "You think i'm a stupid mongoloid?", tons of exposition, dream sequences that cut to a different random guy and his own story... all with those sweet practical effects.
Andrew Getty the person who made this passed away before this movie was completed and had a decade of post production spent on "perfecting it". One thing this has in common with "The Room" is the dedication and belief exhausted into both projects.
https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/mar/14/the-evil-within-horror-movie-andrew-getty-millionaire-meth
To turn out as hilarious as it has is a testament to the little guys that want their project to materialize without intentionally making trash like Sharknado or 50 Shades of Black etc.
This is more competently made than the room though. Highly recommend watching this fucked up.

WRITING.TITLE: (AUS QLD) My father and his "buddy" made a bet together, but the "buddy" gave him a minuscule amount of the winnings.
WRITING.TEXT:
Just wanted to check and see if my dad can get some money out of this if we got a lawyer or if it's a lesson learned don't repeat scenario.
My dad is a regular at the TAB, goes about 2-3 times a week with about $100 each time more as a hobby than addiction. He's older and the friendly chatty type. He usually stays for 4hrs betting $3-8 per bet. To explain his "buddy" in context, he's not really a friend but more of an acquaintance you see every now and again. Try and imagine a guy at your gym that you chat with at the gym and get along well with, but don't hang out or talk or anything outside of the gym.
So this buddy is older and loaded, made a fortune investing in property and is enjoying his retirement in contrast to my dad who does not own anything of value and drives a shitbox (but he's still employed for his age). He goes to the TAB about 3-5 days a week with 8k or so and does the same as my dad but with larger bets etc. $70 trifecta compared to my dad who would do a $4 trifecta.
They get to know each other a bit and sit next to each other talking about their personal life, horses etc. and this buddy begins to trust my dad.
So here we go.
My dad makes his own bets with his own money as does his buddy, and for about the last 6 months his buddy would give my dad $50 every now and again and say something like "bet it all in one go, whatever happens we split it" this guy is absolutely loaded remember, his mid 30's son is basically on an allowance living it up.
Usually not much happens, my dad always returns the ticket to him after writing it then putting it into the teller. And on this one occasion a ticket paid out close to 8k. My dad having previously bet in a race for himself decided he'll just do the same bet again with his buddies money but for a larger dividend etc. Dads ticket cost $8 for 44% of the winnings, while the other dudes ticket cost $50 for about 300%. My dad physically goes up to the teller to put his buddies ticket in and also picked the winning numbers. (The employee at this place knows my dad is not a big gambler if it helps). My dad could win $5k and will still only bet up to $8 in any race.
So same thing as normal when he gave my dad the $50 "whatever happens we split". We had a birthday party to attend that afternoon and my dad left the TAB earlier than normal and missed the entire bet which his buddy collects the winnings from solo. He got me to check his $8 ticket which was a winner and was ecstatic to realize he gets half of his buddies ticket too.
So after a couple days they bump back into each other at the TAB and his buddy says "we only had it for about 90%, I got around 2k and lost it all. Iv'e got $700 on me right now here you can have $200" which he accepted in spite. (The claim he got 2k is a lie, my dad knows! he wrote the ticket! as his $8 ticket was an exact copy but for less winnings) the buddy did not know that my dad also won on the same race so I guess he's trying to misinform him.
It absolutely pisses me off that this rich guy would F my dad over like this, 4k would help our family out alot but is just spare change to this guy. I want to check with you guys if there's anything we can do?

what i think big budget video game movies suffer from.
The checklist of tentpoleness handed down to whoever the director is.
- Must be PG13 so the kiddies can pay to watch it.
- Dumb it down so kids in the Philippines can follow along.
- Add forced humor, shoehorn a love interest.
- No practical effects, CGI all the way.
- We need to be able to sell toys, no scary character designs... if needeed make mongoloids like doomsday.
and pretty much whatever is birthed from such a checklist will turn out garbage... best hope would be a indie filmmaker who's a fan of the source with a 10-20mil budget and having creative control

my take on the odds are:
- Broncos Storm still genuine premiership contenders
- Raiders should have little origin rep players and beat up on teams at the midpoint of the season. Got them 3rd favourites.
- Cowboys Sharks set to drop off while other teams will be improving...either one or both could fill 6-8th on ladder, not suprised if either just miss the 8. Sharks losing Ennis will hurt way more than Barba. He led the team for try assists in their 2015 season. Cowboys lose Tamou, still have a gun team but I feel they were the first genuine back to back premiers we've had in a while and it's no coincidence they dropped off part to Granville who was soo influential in 2015 having had a poor 2016 season... he and Cowboys could bounce back however.
- Panthers top 8 near certainties, but at that price you pretty much can only add the $1.40 to multi's you don't mind a later payout on. I do not consider them premiership contenders however due to the youth on stock especially at 6 7 whether its Cleary/Martin or Carty, they'll be able to muster wins during the season but finals pressure is a whole different beast for a young halves combination. Future is exciting though, they'll be contending from 2018 unless some kind of scandal or mass players exodus happen.
- Roosters, Warriors, Titans, Rabbitohs, Bulldogs top 8 hopes with Warriors, Titans and Rabbitohs most likely of the five to emerge as dark horses. I'm really keen on the warriors chances this year and at their price i'm going all in with Top 4, Top 8, Reach GF and win GF going in ALOT of multis. WRITING.TEXT:

They lockdown the ruck and always get three guys involved to smother the ball carrier in a tackle and will slow that shit right down. If you don't have good offloaders your pretty much going to be limited to possession in your own half.
Kick pressure from cam smith compounds this with munster/slater able to get to everything on the full and return it to the 30m line. They don't miss many tackles either.
With their goal line defence they mark up better than other teams, your best scoring opportunities usually will rely on the 1 on 1 situation and beating the storm guy. etc. hard to get an overlap against them of one of those shitty second man plays but when/if the ball gets to the fullback/centre/winger they need to beat their man rather than stroll into a gap.
Also they hand brown paper bags of cash to the referees as insurance to make sure the penalty count is in their favour.

lachlan maranta:

I'm ape shit over club footy and don't really care about origin, but origin is one hell of a spectacle and am totally in awe of the constant high quality it delivers. I WANT to love test footy but it's a boring mess. Test footy needs a complete overhaul of eligibility and tournament structures. Better we ignore it so they realize changes must be made.
There's no underdogs to root for, when Fiji, Samoa, Tonga unearth some beasts AU NZ will groom them like a internet pedophile. When Cronk JT retire you'd expect Milford will be the next in line however I'm annoyed that:
a) He has no incentive to play for Samoa, money talks and AU will get their man.
b) The standard of rosters nowdays is exceptional with tons of talent spread across the comp and AU can easily pick a great five eight who will do a great job but will instead step on Samoa's balls by picking Milford. (Same for the likes of Semi)
Also I feel there's no prestige in test footy, AU are always good every now and again NZ compete. While England might one day join them it's always a AU NZ circle jerk whether its a tri nations or world cup victory. Winning a grand final is a 26 week marathon with a 4 week sprint where the winners are gladiators of the competition. A tri nations victory is pretty much, beat up on England play NZ in the final and sometimes win as if it's one mighty achievement anyone should care about.
Test footy should be ignored until we get a better standard.

WRITING.TITLE: In 2017 who makes it into the eight at the current 8's expense?
WRITING.TEXT:
Was thinking about how hard it is to make a case for anyone in this years eight to miss out... but it will happen due to the impossibility of getting the same eight two years in a row.
Titans likely drop out but they have a good roster, I don't like the dogs cause of Lichaa who's a big problem for their attack but man Hasler is just always in the finals isn't he.
I'm liking the Rabbitohs, Roosters and Warriors to push their way in... Before everyone comments how the warriors will lock up 9th, they're due for finals footy and Kearny has sprinkled some magic on the test team who have been outstanding. Rabbitohs spine is one of the best in the comp, but Gurgess needs to bounce back into form since they lost Nathan Brown. Roosters were crippled at the start of the year without Pearce, Cordner and JWH also Latrell's inexperience at a key position let them down, he'll need this season on the wing for his development while Gordon provides immediate reliability.
In my eyes only the Eels, Tigers, Dragons Knights don't have a case. When you dissect the Eels roster they are in real trouble, Robson and Degois are G.O.A.T players though so who knows. Tigers might be one of the two youngest rosters next year, no way they'll be consistent. Dragons roster got worse, no evidence to show they can turn it around. Knights self explanatory.
Who do you guys reckon will make it?

Good on him, though let's still look at this guy going forward.
The wing is the most productive position in the NRL, year in and out we get freaks debut and sometimes develop their skills to move into fullback/center/second row and become versatile. Those guys that stay stuck on the wing have to compete against those 20yo prodigies year after year.
Then you arrive at a crossroads go down the Jason Nightingale path where your high workrate, finishing and versatility sees a productive career... or the Nathan Merritt path where while young will call upon freakish try scoring instincts but then as you move into your late 20's speed will drop off and season try tallies of single digits.
He will be a liability on the defensive side of the ball on the wing, if we are gonna see the best of french hopefully he's got some amazing ball-playing ability to move to fullback. He does not have the high hit-up workrate to sustain a career on the wing.
